body.p: How do diarrheal diseases influence water homeostasis?

multiple_choice.choice: Bacteria toxins stimulate the large intestine cells to excrete excess water.
Bacteria toxins prevent water absorption in the large intestine.
Virus toxins prevent water absorption in the small intestine.
Bacteria toxins stimulate the small intestine to excrete excess water.

feedback.p: Incorrect. The toxins do not cause excess water to leave the cells; it prevents them from taking it up.
Correct. The bacterial toxins bind to the cells and prevent the water from being absorbed into the cells of the large intestine.
Incorrect. Diarrheal diseases result from the large intestine not the small intestine not being able to absorb water.
Incorrect. Diarrheal diseases result from the large intestine not the small intestine not being able to absorb water.
